intro: Saurauia kuswatae, commonly known as the Kuswatae stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in the spring. Saurauia kuswatae is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
